name: Banana Bungalow Maui Hostel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were just about disappointed as soon as we opened the door to our room. This hostel was a dud. The room was uncomfortable. Little furniture forced us to store our belongings on the dirty floor. There was only one working outlet. There was no A/C or heat therefore leaving the windows, which had no screens, open during the night was necessary. Street traffic was loud and consistent and neighbors had roosters which crowed all night.
reviews.title: Hostel is infested with bedbugs.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were many bathrooms and few of them seemed to be recently renovated, however they were always dirty and hot water was never a given throughout the stay.
reviews.title: You call this a hostel???

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hostel brags about it's large kitchen with stainless steel sinks and granite counter tops open to all guests for use, however the room was disgusting. No one ever cleaned the sinks and there was always a mound of food waste greeting you. Everyone was expected to clean after themselves but this simply didn't happen. The kitchen itself is open to the outdoors allowing insects and other small animals free range.
reviews.title: Amazing people, Amazing Staff, Amazing tours!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Adjacent to the kitchen was the hang out rooms, there was a big T.V. and stereo and the normal stuff you find at any hostel. However actually hanging out in this room wasn't really that appealing. There was always a weird mixture of travelers, locals, staff on and off duty, their dogs and random cats who kind of just sat around and smoked. The vibe always seemed to be what you would expect back stage at an indie show in some lame college town. Hardly a nice place to relax at the end of a long day.
reviews.title: Delivered what it promised!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The cast of characters always just kind of hanging out, was interesting considering the hostel seems to be really strict at who it allowed to stay. They specifically claim they are geared to the backpacker yet everyone seemed to be staff, friends of staff, or maybe previous staff members, locals, and clearly people who were not backpacking or even traveling for that matter, or somewhere in between.
reviews.title: Change the name to Banana Bughole

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: Overall, I was really happy with my stay at the Banana Bungalow in August '10. I started to stay in hostels rather than hotels in 2008 and despite any shortcomings they have I've always been happy with my stays overall. Alaska Airlines had an amzing fare sale to Hawaii so I planned a last-minute trip. The main draw for me was the price. $168 for a week on Maui. Not sure many other places are less than $168 a night! Of course, you sleep in a bunkbed, and are miles from the beach- but- my view is that no matter where you stay or what you sleep on you can still get anywhere you need to go! The hostel provides free tours everyday which give this hostel more value than any other I have stayed at. I did some of the tours, and found that other days i just preffered to use the local bus and tour around on my own.
reviews.title: One Week here for the Cost of One Night Elsewhere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011
reviews.text: The hostel is in a very local part of town. I don't want to call it ugly, but well- its not what comes to mind when you think of the beautiful isle of Maui, but then again I also found that to be part of the charm. A dirty road outside, a local market with all kinds of Hawaiian and Asian takeout within a 1 minute walk, and a cute little downtown area (Wailuku) 5 minute walk away. Local buses that can take you to every part of the island are also just a short walk. Several times I took this bus to Lahaina, Kaanapali, Kapalua and Kehei. For me the journey is as important as the destination so each of these bus rides were more like senic tours to me.
reviews.title: Rude!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nightlife at the hostel was quite fun. There was a great group of people from all over the world that got together, cooked dinner, drank and went out to Karaoke together. When I felt the need for more solitude there was a hammock in a garden and I spent many hours reading and listening to the call of the tropical birds. Staff were mostly friendly, partied with us and did there best to enforce thre quiet hours so those of us getting up at dawn for a tour could get some sleep. So it was the best of both worlds, you could be social and party, or be alone and get some sleep when you needed it. I had no major complaints at all- no thefts, no bedbugs- in fact I slept better in my little bunk than I had at home! - but I would say the kitchen could have been a little cleaner, the staff a little more attentive- some you really wondered if they were working or just hanging out, and the tour guides could have guided more on the tours. but these are minor details to me. I would recommend this place to anyone who is a happy-go-lucky traveller looking for a deal and fun and friends!
reviews.title: best hostel i've had the pleasure of staying at and i've been around

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Turned us away because we had a person in a wheelchair with us. Enough said.
reviews.title: GREAT PEOPLE, GREAT STAFF

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: Very friendly and helpful staff. Clean and charming rooms. The free tours (all you need to do is trip the drivers, they are awesome and you'll want to) and the reasonable nightly rates make Maui possible on a tight budget.
reviews.title: Delightful stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: I've been there for 12 nights during new years eve and the beginning of january and it was just awesome! They offer free tours everyday, the tourguides and the staff is great. I traveled alone and I've met a lot of awesome people and had a great time with them. This hostel is definately worth a trip to Maui!
reviews.title: The place to be on Maui!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: You really feel like at home. Awesome daily excursions for free, you just tip the guides who are awesome. Jacuzzi, party at night, special dinners, etc. What else could you need?
reviews.title: THIS IS THE PLACE YOU WANT TO BE IF YOU TAVEL ALONE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved this place!!! From the moment I walked in I felt at home and had a great time!!! The staff was friendly, helpful and works very hard at keeping the place clean and takin care of!! I did a gig at the Ritz Carlton and stayed my forst two nights there!!! I was laughing to myself that I was going from the Ritz to Banana bungalow... Well let me tell you I didn't start having fun or truely enjoy my stay in Hawaii till I got to the banana Bung!!! Thanks to everyone for making my stay soooooo great!!!!
reviews.title: The best!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: I stayed at the Bungalow for a week in november and I loved my stay ! The staff is very friendly and there for you when you need it. The rooms were clean and they were doing their best to avoid bed bugs (which I appreciated, you don't want bed bugs to ruin your vacation !)
reviews.title: Good place to have fun !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I took 4 of the free tours and everytime the guides were fun and sympathetic. And as a solo traveler, I've meet a lot of people there which was nice.
reviews.title: BEST of the Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: During our island hopping on Hawaii we stayed one week on Maui at this great hostel. We joined the amazing tours and saw many places around the island. Special thanks to Nadine and Isaac who did a really good job as tour guides!
reviews.title: Great stay on Maui

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: This was the best and most fun hostel I've ever stayed at. I've been traveling Hawaii for three weeks and spent one week on Maui in this awesome hostel. Sure, the neighbourhood could be better, but the hostel is nice and clean, the staff is very friendly. The other guests were the most fun and interesting people I've ever met at a hostel.
reviews.title: Awesome Hostel - best ever - great tours

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: The best thing of all are the tours: They offer free (!) tours every day of the week, a total of 7 different tours. Those tours take you to every interesting spot on the island. And those aren't any stupid, boring tourist tours, but really great tours leading you also to some hidden spots you wouldn't find by yourself. The tourdrivers don't get paid, you only tip them if you liked the tour. That's really a great concept, as the tour drivers aren't just doing their job (being bored by doing the same tour over and over again), but really enjoy doing those tours themselves. Fun is guaranteed.
reviews.title: Drive By Shooting - Dangerous Area of Town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: 100% recommended - if you ever go to Maui and want to stay at a fun hostel, chose this one! Next time I'm on Maui, I'll come to the Bungalow again!
reviews.title: Very nice place to stay if in Maui =)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: I was parked right outside the hostel (where they told me to park), when in the middle of the night a car comes by and sprays gunfire down the street, hitting at least 4 cars including mine. A convenience store clerk nearby told me this hostel is in the "Ghetto" part of town and the police are always parked nearby. This place in no bargain at any price.
reviews.title: Terrific place to stay!

description: The hostel caters to backpackers, travelers and surfers wanting to get the best out of Maui,and the best value for their money. Your stay comes with a friendly atmosphere, camaraderie, and friendships that last a lifetime. We offer more free amenities than any other hostel in Hawaii, probably the world. We offer FREE TOURS of MAUI EVERY DAY!: 12-Mile Haleakala Volcano Hike, The Road to Hana, Iao Valley Rainforest Hike, Whale Watching (seasonal), Snorkel with Turtles, Historic Lahaina and Paia Towns, Beaches, Beaches, Beaches!Large Tropical Garden with 7-Person Jacuzzi, Large Shared Kitchen, Free Wi-Fi, Free Internet Computer, Free pancake breakfast, Free keg parties every Friday night! "BACKPACKERS SHOULD HEAD TO BANANA BUNGALOW" - Frommer's 2011, "LIVELY AND COSMOPOLITAN HOSTEL" - Fodor's 2011.
